definition: to dissolve/to disband
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to transport under guard
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
surname Xie
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
variant of 散[san4]

sentences.english: In fact, the legibility of the spring was dissolved only gradually.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，易读的春天才逐渐解散。

sentences.english: By introducing a typical case this paper expounds the common reasons for disbanding a corporation compulsorily in judicial procedure.
sentences.chinese: 以典型案例作引子，阐明了公司司法解散的理由。

sentences.english: Having accomplished its mission, the Metrication Committee was dissolved in January 1998.
sentences.chinese: 委员会终于完成使命，并已于一九九八年一月解散。

sentences.english: You have to discard any thoughts of disbanding.
sentences.chinese: 你必须丢弃一切解散军队的念头。

sentences.english: But the reality is that dissolution rates are higher among cohabiting couples than remarried couples.
sentences.chinese: 现实是同居配偶的解散率高于再婚配偶。

sentences.english: It had petered out soon after Anne's marriage.
sentences.chinese: 其实它早在安妮结婚之后就解散了。

sentences.english: Mattil said the Office of Accountability and Transparency was dismantled last December.
sentences.chinese: 马蒂尔说，问责与透明办公室去年12月解散了。

sentences.english: They stayed in their hammocks until the congregation had dispersed.
sentences.chinese: 他们一直在吊床上待着，等教堂里的会众解散。

sentences.english: After a few moments the captain of the guard dismissed the soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 须臾侍卫首领便解散了那些士兵。
他们解散了该合股公司。

sentences.english: America's betrayal of the democratic parties was the main reason for the disbandment of Democratic League.
sentences.chinese: 美国对民主党派的背信弃义，是民盟解散的一大原因。

sentences.english: The reasons for dissolution of the company and liquidation methods.
sentences.chinese: 公司的解散事由与清算办法。

sentences.english: You're certainly not gonna fooking split up over an argument.
sentences.chinese: 你当然不能因为一次吵架就闹解散。

sentences.english: In August 1975, the emir dissolved the parliament by royal decree.
sentences.chinese: 1975年8月，巴林君主以皇家敕令解散了国会。

sentences.english: The Chief Executive must consult the Executive Council before dissolving the Legislative Council.
sentences.chinese: 行政长官在解散立法会前，须征询行政会议的意见。

sentences.english: I was so absorbed in the series of 'Harry Potter', because it's so amazing.
sentences.chinese: 我沉迷在哈里波特系列丛书里，因为好好解散。

definition: to disband/(of a partnership, group etc) to break up
to withdraw/to abort/to quit/to log out (computing)
to go separate ways (idiom)/to part ways with sb/Taiwan pr. [ge4 ben1 dong1 xi1]
to reorganize/to reshuffle (posts etc)
to organize/to set up/to establish
member/group member
member
to collapse and fall apart (idiom); to break up/falling to pieces
lit. to take different roads and urge the horses on (idiom)/fig. to part ways
group/organization/team/CL:個|个[ge4]
to go bankrupt/to become impoverished/bankruptcy
to strike off (the rolls)/to remove from a list/to expunge/to expel
the name remains, but the reality is gone (idiom)
lit. to form an army/to set up (team, group, band, organization etc)/to found/opening (ceremony)/to commission (arms system, naval vessel)/to graduate from an apprenticeship
to depart/to leave
to return to one's unit/to go back to one's station in life
